casebody.data:
William M. BYRON and Dana T. Byron
v.
SYNCO PROPERTIES, INC., a North Carolina Corporation, and City of Charlotte, a North Carolina body politic and corporate No. 127P18 Supreme Court of North Carolina. August 14, 2018 Madeline J. Trilling, Attorney at Law, for Byron, William M., et al. Kenneth T. Davies, Attorney at Law, for Byron, William M., et al. Thomas E. Powers, III, Assistant City Attorney, for City of Charlotte. Terrie V. Hagler-Gray, Senior Assistant City Attorney, for City of Charlotte. Roy H. Michaux, Jr., Attorney at Law, for Synco Properties, Inc. James E. Scarborough, Attorney at Law, for Byron, William M., et al.

ORDER

Upon consideration of the petition filed on the 25th of April 2018 by Plaintiffs in this matter for discretionary review of the decision of the North Carolina Court of Appeals pursuant to G.S. 7A-31, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 14th of August 2018."
